response:
A 41-year-old man with known multiple sclerosis and a 14-day evolution of combined brainstem and optic nerve signs most likely has an inflammatory demyelinating relapse, but the severity of the oculomotor palsy and raised inflammatory markers require exclusion of alternative inflammatory, vascular and neoplastic midbrain lesions and systemic inflammatory diseases.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis relapse with left midbrain plaque and right optic neuritis", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein (MOG) antibody\u2013associated demyelinating disease", "Left midbrain infarction (Benedikt or Claude syndrome)", "Intrinsic left midbrain tumour (e.g., glioma or lymphoma)", "Neurosarcoidosis involving optic nerve and brainstem"]
